de.wi08e.myhome.frontend
Class FrontendInterface

java.lang.Object
  de.wi08e.myhome.frontend.FrontendInterface

public class FrontendInterface
extends java.lang.Object

This is the main frontend interface. It is modeled to be a SOAP-Interface via javax.jws.WebService Most methods require an userToken. This token can be acquired by login() and is valid for a certain time (default: 30min) after the last successful request with this token.

Author:
Marek

Method Detail

login

public LoginResponse login(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
                    throws LoginUsernameOrPasswordWrong
The main login method

Parameters:
username - The username of the person trying to log in. It's case-insensitive
password - The corresponding password. It's case-sensitive
Returns:
LoginReponse The returning class contains an "isAdmin"-boolean and the newly generated userToken
Throws:
LoginUsernameOrPasswordWrong - Thrown when password or username is wrong

checkUserToken

public boolean checkUserToken(java.lang.String userToken)
Checks if userToken is still valid

Parameters:
userToken -
Returns:
true if valid

logout

public void logout(java.lang.String userToken)
            throws NotLoggedIn
Logging the user out

Parameters:
userToken -
Throws:
NotLoggedIn - Is thrown when the given userToken can't be found. This mostly happens after a session timeout

listUsers

public UserResponse[] listUsers(java.lang.String userToken)
                         throws NotLoggedIn,
                                NoAdminRights
Lists all users or just one special user (requires admin rights)

Parameters:
userToken - Session user token
Returns:
Array of UserResponse containing username, fullname and isAdmin flag
Throws:
NotLoggedIn - Is thrown when the given userToken can't be found. This mostly happens after a session timeout
NoAdminRights - Is thrown when the user has no admin rights and therefore can't see this list.

getUser

public UserResponse getUser(java.lang.String userToken,
                            java.lang.String username)
                     throws NotLoggedIn,
                            NoAdminRights,
                            UserNotFound
Returns the user with the given username (requires admin rights)

Parameters:
userToken - Session user token
username - Username of the requested user
Returns:
UserResponse UserResponse object containing username, fullname and isAdmin flag
Throws:
NotLoggedIn - Is thrown when the given userToken can't be found. This mostly happens after a session timeout
NoAdminRights - Is thrown when the user has no admin rights and therefore can't use this function.
UserNotFound - Thrown when username is not found in database

deleteUser

public void deleteUser(java.lang.String userToken,
                       java.lang.String username)
                throws NotLoggedIn,
                       NoAdminRights,
                       UserNotFound
Deletes an user (requires admin rights)

Parameters:
userToken - Session user token
username - Username of the user which should be deleted
Throws:
NotLoggedIn - Is thrown when the given userToken can't be found. This mostly happens after a session timeout
NoAdminRights - Is thrown when the user has no admin rights and therefore can't use this function.
UserNotFound - Thrown when username is not found in database

changePassword

public void changePassword(java.lang.String userToken,
                           java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password)
                    throws NotLoggedIn,
                           NoAdminRights,
                           UserNotFound,
                           PasswordTooShort
Change the password for an user (requires admin rights when not changing you own password)

Parameters:
userToken - Session user token
username - Username of the user which should be deleted
password - New password
Throws:
NotLoggedIn - Is thrown when the given userToken can't be found. This mostly happens after a session timeout
NoAdminRights - Is thrown when the user has no admin rights and therefore can't use this function.
UserNotFound - Thrown when username is not found in database
PasswordTooShort - Thrown when the password is too short

addUser

public void addUser(java.lang.String userToken,
                    java.lang.String username,
                    java.lang.String password)
             throws NotLoggedIn,
                    NoAdminRights,
                    PasswordTooShort,
                    UsernameTooShortOrInvalid,
                    UsernameAlreadyInUse
Creates a new user account (requires admin rights)

Parameters:
userToken - Session user token
username - Username of the user which should be added
fullname - Fullname of the user which should be added
password - Password
Throws:
NotLoggedIn - Is thrown when the given userToken can't be found. This mostly happens after a session timeout
NoAdminRights - Is thrown when the user has no admin rights and therefore can't use this function.
PasswordTooShort - Thrown when the password is too short
UsernameTooShortOrInvalid - Thrown when username is too short or invalid
UsernameAlreadyInUse - Thrown when username is already used by someone else
